author: Staff Reporter
text:
After a gap of 31 years, the Mahakumbabhishekam of Sri Thenkalai Srinivasa Perumal Temple at Muthialpet will be held on Friday.

As the last kumbabhishekam was performed on February 8, 1985, renovation of the temple was taken up in a big way to spruce up the famous temple.

The renovation of the temple which is under the control of the Hindu Religious Institutions was taken up at a cost of Rs. 2.76 crore in 2012, said Durai Balakrishnan, executive officer of the temple. The works commenced with the construction of new shrines in the temple and a Rajagopuram with five tiers.

A sum of Rs.2.5 crore has been spent so far.

The renovation was carried out as per agama rules under the supervision of V. Sathyamoorthy and A.P. Aroumougame from the Project Implementation Agency (PIA).
title: Srinivasa Perumal Temple consecration today
